Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies and Miami Marlins are set to face off on September 7, 2024, at 4:10 pm at LoanDepot park.
The starting pitchers for the game are Darren McCaughan for the Miami Marlins and Aaron Nola for the Philadelphia Phillies.
The betting odds for the game are Miami Marlins +185 / Philadelphia Phillies -222 and the Over/Under is 8.5.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be broadcast on BALLY and NBCSN.
Philadelphia Phillies Betting Preview: The Philadelphia Phillies lost their last two games against the Toronto Blue Jays but won their last game against the Miami Marlins 16-2.
Zack Wheeler started the last game for the Philadelphia Phillies and lasted 6.0 innings with one earned run.
Miami Marlins Betting Preview: The Miami Marlins played a pair against the Washington Nationals and split the series.
Austin Kitchen gave up seven earned runs in 2.0 innings as a starter in the last game for the Miami Marlins.
Total Runs Facts: Each of the Marlins' last five-day games against NL East opponents has gone UNDER the total runs line.
Four of the Phillies' last five games as favorites have gone UNDER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the last five games between the Phillies and Marlins.
The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Phillies' last four road games.

Kyle Schwarber has hit at least one home run in three of the Phillies' last four road games against opponents that held a losing record.
